dmca.title: Pirelli 'Tires' of Eponymous Website
dmca.body:
Dear Mr. Pirelli:
 
 
           We are the attorneys for Pirelli S.p.A. ("Pirelli"), the 
 owner of the trademarks, service marks and trade names PIRELLI.
  
           We hereby demand that you cease and desist from using the 
 domain name "Pirelliweb.com" and the trade name "Pirelli Web 
 Publishing."  These uses infringe upon and dilute Pirelli's rights in 
 its marks.
  
           Since 1872, Pirelli has continuously been engaged in the 
manufacture, advertising, distribution, and sale of a wide variety of 
tire, energy, and telecom related products and services to the general
public and  a broad group of businesses and industries.  The PIRELLI 
trademark, service  mark and trade name, synonymous with high quality 
in regard to these products and services, has been in constant use over 
this period.

 Currently, Pirelli owns over twenty federal trademark applications and
 registrations incorporating the PIRELLI mark, many of which are now
 incontestable.  Every year, Pirelli and its affiliates heavily advertise
 and market products and services under the world famous PIRELLI names and
 marks and realize millions of dollars in sales of products and services in
 the United States alone.  The value of the names and marks to Pirelli is
 enormous, and Pirelli is committed to protecting the marks against
 unauthorized use by other entities.
 
            The fame of the PIRELLI trademark under U.S. trademark law
 already has been upheld and recognized in federal court.   As stated by
 the  Court in Pirelli Armstrong Tire Corp. v. Titan Tire Corp., "Pirelli's 
 trademarks are famous.  The trademarks have been registered for over 
 80 years and are incontestable."  4 F. Supp.2d 794, 802 (C.D. Ill. 
 1998).
  
           The use of "Pirelliweb" as your company's domain name on the 
 worldwide web and the use of "Pirelli Web Publishing" as your 
 company's trade name are infringements of Pirelli's trademarks, 
 service marks and trade names.  These uses are likely to cause 
 confusion by mistakenly causing people to assume that your products or 
 services either originate with Pirelli, or are sponsored or endorsed 
 by, or connected with Pirelli. Such uses therefore constitute 
 trademark infringement and unfair competition under sections 32 and 
 43(a) of the Lanham Act and other federal, state, and common law 
 provisions governing trademark infringement, dilution, and unfair 
 competition.
 
            To protect Pirelli's rights and the public from confusion, 
 Pirelli hereby demands that you immediately and permanently cease and 
 desist from using PIRELLI in your domain name and trade name, and from 
 any and all other use of Pirelli's trademarks, service marks and trade 
 names. We further demand that you forthwith release the domain name 
 "Pirelliweb.com" for our use.
  
           Please indicate your agreement to cease and desist form the 
 use of PIRELLI and to release the domain name for our use by printing 
 out this email, signing it in the space provided below and returning a 
 copy of the letter to me no later than January 31, 2001.  If we do not 
 receive your agreement by this date, we will have no choice but to 
 pursue other appropriate action.
 
            By sending you this letter, Pirelli is not waiving any of 
 its legal or equitable rights or remedies, all of which are expressly 
 reserved. If you have any questions, you or your attorney may contact 
 me at [number], or my associate, [Private] at [number].
 
 
                          Very truly yours,
 
 
                          [Attorney]
                          Weil, Gotshal & Manges LLP
                          767 Fifth Avenue
                          New York, New York 10153
                          Tel:  xxx xxx-xxxx
                          Fax:  xxx xxx-xxxx
 
 
 
 Agreed:
 
 
 _______________________________
 Joseph D. Pirelli
 
 
 cc:  [Private]
 
 
 
 
 **********NOTE**********
 The information contained in this email message is intended only for 
 use of the individual or entity named above.  If the reader of this 
 message is not the intended recipient, or the employee or agent 
 responsible to deliver it to the intended recipient, you are hereby 
 notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this 
 communication is strictly prohibited.  If you have received this 
 communication in error, please immediately notify us by telephone 
 (212-310-8000), and destroy the original message. Thank you.
